ocr_create_image_data.py

1 import numpy as np
2 import imutils
3 import cv2
4 
5 def is_contour_bad(c):
6  # approximate the contour
7  if cv2.contourArea(c)>20:
8  [x,y,w,h] = cv2.boundingRect(c)
9  if h>20:
10  return False
11 
12  # the contour is 'bad' if it is not digit
13  return True
14 
15 capture = cv2.VideoCapture(0)
16 capture.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_WIDTH, 640)
17 capture.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_HEIGHT, 480)
18 
19 number = 0
20 while cv2.waitKey(33) < 0:
21  ret, frame = capture.read()
22  #cv2.imshow("VideoFrame", frame)
23 
24  cv_image = cv2.flip(frame,-1)
25  #cv2.imshow("cv_image", cv_image)
26 
27  x=300; y=240; w=40; h=40
28  roi_img = cv_image[y:y+h, x:x+w]
29  cv2.imshow('roi_img', roi_img)
30 
31  #
32  hsv = cv2.cvtColor(roi_img, cv2.COLOR_BGR2HSV)
33 
34  rng_1 = cv2.inRange(hsv, (0, 100, 0), (255, 255, 150))
35  rng_2 = cv2.inRange(hsv, (0, 0, 0), (255, 255, 80))
36 
37  cv2.imshow('rng_1', rng_1)
38  cv2.imshow('rng_2', rng_2)
39 
40  sum = rng_1 + rng_2
41  cv2.imshow('sum', sum)
42 
43  # Removing noise
44  # https://pyimagesearch.com/2015/02/09/removing-contours-image-using-python-opencv/
45 
46  cnts = cv2.findContours(sum,cv2.RETR_EXTERNAL,cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE)
47  cnts = imutils.grab_contours(cnts)
48  mask = np.ones(sum.shape[:2], dtype="uint8") * 255
49 
50  # loop over the contours
51  for c in cnts:
52  # if the contour is bad, draw it on the mask
53  if is_contour_bad(c):
54  cv2.drawContours(mask, [c], -1, 0, -1)
55 
56  # remove the contours from the image and show the resulting images
57  sum = cv2.bitwise_and(sum, sum, mask=mask)
58  cv2.imshow("Mask", mask)
59  cv2.imshow("After", sum)
60  # https://hoony-gunputer.tistory.com/entry/OpenCv-python-%EA%B8%B0%EC%B4%88-%EC%9D%B4%EB%AF%B8%EC%A7%80-%EC%9D%BD%EA%B3%A0-%EC%A0%80%EC%9E%A5%ED%95%98%EA%B8%B0
61  name = '/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/dataset/9/' + str(number) + '.jpg'
62  cv2.imwrite(name, sum)
63  cv2.waitKey(0)
64 
65  number = number + 1
66 
67 
68 capture.release()
69 cv2.destroyAllWindows()
